de.iabg.swing.filechooser
Class AbstractFilter

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter
      de.iabg.swing.filechooser.AbstractFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
MeshFilter, ModeFilter
public abstract class AbstractFilter
extends javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter

This abstract implementation of FileFilter provides subclasses with the ability to be a filter for a single given extension. The accept(java.io.File) method checks the extension of the file and accepts a file only if it matches the stored extension.

Version:
September 10, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Method Detail

accept

public boolean accept(java.io.File file)
Tests whether or not the specified abstract pathname should be included in a pathname list. Directories and files with the given extension are accepted.

Specified by:
accept in class javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter
Parameters:
file - The file to be tested
Returns:
true if the file should be accepted; false otherwise

getExtension

protected java.lang.String getExtension(java.io.File file)
Returns the extension of the given file as an upper case string.

Parameters:

Returns:
the string extension of the given file
